description: This source file defines the NoteEditorFragment, a Kotlin class for an Android app that handles creating and editing notes with validation. It manages UI interactions, data loading, validation logic, and saving operations for note editing functionality.

classes.name: NoteEditorFragment
classes.description: A Fragment class that provides UI and logic for editing or creating notes, including input validation, data loading, and saving.

methods.name: onCreate
methods.description: Initializes the fragment, retrieves note ID from arguments, and sets up menu options.

methods.name: onCreateView
methods.description: Inflates the fragment layout and sets up view binding.

methods.name: onViewCreated
methods.description: Sets up text change listeners for input validation, loads existing note if editing, and initializes save button listener.

methods.name: validate
methods.description: Checks if title or content fields are non-blank and updates UI error messages and button states accordingly.

methods.name: saveNote
methods.description: Saves the note either by updating existing or adding new, with validation and navigation.

methods.name: onDestroyView
methods.description: Nullifies the binding to prevent memory leaks.
